boardgame.name: Birds of a Feather: Western North America
boardgame.description:
Grab your binoculars and your birding journal because it's time to hit the trails and see some birds. Choose a habitat each round to visit along the western coast of North America, and see what rare birds you can find. Don't forget to keep an eye on what your fellow birders are tracking down — they might just lead you to the bird that finishes your watch list and earns you extra points! Who will outsmart their opponents, spot the most birds, and be the best birder?

In Birds of a Feather: Western North America, you and the other players explore different habitats to spot birds. In the first round, each player chooses and reveals a card from hand, then marks off on their score sheet or the app the bird they played as well as all other birds played in the same habitat. The deck contains cards from five habitats, with some birds being more common than others. In the second round, you each play a card again, then you mark all birds in your current habitat as well as all cards played the previous round in that habitat. Apparently word spread about all the great finds! Remove all cards from the first round, then keep playing additional rounds in the same manner.

When each player has only one card left in hand, the game ends. For each ace bird you've seen in a habitat, you score 2 points; for each other non-common bird you've seen, score 1 point; and if you've seen all seven types of birds in a habitat, score 3 bonus points for a total of 10 points in that habitat. Whoever has the most total points wins.

Birds of a Feather: Western North America differs from Birds of Feather thanks to new graphic design and improved rules for two- and three-player games to make them more strategic.

boardgame.name: The Traveling Cat Game
boardgame.description:
The Traveling Cat Game is a board game with the goal of completing a world map from 108 tiles while moving a cat named Ricky from region to region.

Players work from an initial set of tiles that, like a puzzle, make up parts of the map. They continue to draw a tile at each turn, using the tiles to correctly build out the map, but only setting tiles in the regions where Ricky the Cat is currently visiting. Players can only move the cat to new regions based on their play. Some caution is required to ensure your tiles actually correspond with the country or land mass you intend to use them on. Knowledge of global maps or experience with puzzles is helpful.

The winner must get all their tiles onto the map first, and this is best accomplished by retaining tiles for strategic regions, passing or acting on certain opportunities, and, maintaining options to move Ricky the Cat when and where desired. After someone wins, the remaining players can continue the game to complete the global map competing with moves to use up their tiles soonest.

boardgame.name: Unsettled: Koguya
boardgame.description:
Untangle an ever-changing planet-sized knot of vines to reveal hidden secrets and the means to go on going on. Unsettled: Koguya is the 7th planet box for "Unsettled".

Koguya is a massive tangle of tanglies; a rubberband-ball-like orb of entwined vines that are grabbing, pulling, and throwing you about as you attempt to do what needs doing. Launch yourself around on spring-like vine coils, swing from place to place like a classic jungle fantasy, and slip through tunnels as you scavenge your way through the various refuge and space-waste the vines have plucked up and claimed on their eons-long journey across the cosmos.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unsettled: Blackout
boardgame.description:
Restore power to the Scarab before a malfunctioning Luna turns your lights out for good. Unsettled: Blackout is the 8th planet box for "Unsettled".

Research on a mysterious substance has triggered a bizarre explosion, plunging the ship into near-complete darkness and compromising Luna, who no longer recognizes you as friendly. You must fund a way to get the power back on while thwarting Luna's attempts to de-conscious you. Pile equipment into barricades, distract her with loud noises, or just jump out the airlock if she gets too close. Whatever you do, don't let her catch you; you know all-too-well how effective she is.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unsettled: Gniir
boardgame.description:
It's kill-you-instantly cold outside. Somehow, that's the least of your problems. Unsettled: Gniir is the 9th planet box for "Unsettled".

An eerie, ethereal sense of uncertainty haunts every moment on this frost-goth world of ice and stone. Monolithic ruins loom in the distance, eerily preserved, disturbingly quiet. More unnerving yet, is the presence you can sense but cannot see. You feel it, in the howling wind, in the drifts of snow, around you, inside you.

Gniir is about finding shelter from more than just the elements. The resources you need can be found, but only in places you can't survive. It's a whole thing. You'll work it out.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battle Pufs
boardgame.description:
Battle pufs is an action packed game for friends and families.
There are 2 modes battle royale where you win by being the last one standing.
Or timed royale you set a timer and either the last player wins or if there are still players remaining you count the stars at the bottom of your puf cards and the player with the most stars wins. You shuffle both decks and deal 3 puf cards to each player and they get 7 battle cards unless otherwise stated.

Everytime they end there turn or use a card they draw back up to 7 reveal cards face up infront of you. Keep doing this until no one is left or you run out of time.

boardgame.name: Inflatable Antler Ring Toss Game
boardgame.description:
Enjoy this hilarious game at all your holiday parties. Your friends and family will love tossing the rings onto these inflatable antlers All ages will have a blast using this as an excuse to throw things at your head! Easily inflate the antlers and you are ready to play the game.

One person wears antlers that are inflated and the other players/teams toss inflatable red and green rings, trying to hook the rings over the antlers. Play until a certain score is reached (5 points for a short game, 20 for a long one).

boardgame.name: Unsettled: Survival Task Community Pack
boardgame.description: A minimum of 24 all-new survival tasks for the first six planets based on concepts designed by the community of the second Unsettled Kickstarter campaign.

boardgame.name: Unsettled: Scientific Specializations
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds unique actions to unlock for each crew member.

Use your scientific specialization in tandem with environment-specific comprehension to perform actions unique to your character.

Lean on your scientific training to discover how all of this peculiar, newly-acquired comprehension has significance that could keep everyone breathing a bit longer. With the Scientific Specializations module, your "aha!" moments allow you to specialize in ways others cannot—which is a good thing if you all want to survive whatever "this" is and celebrate all of those breaths you've taken for granted.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unsettled: Scientific Fascinations
boardgame.description:
Give in to your idiosyncratic intrigues...perhaps at the expense of your crew...in the hopes that your mind can solve what others haven't been able to.

Take the gamble—use the insights you gain to fill in the mysterious gaps you've been pondering throughout your life instead of the application outlined for the task at hand. If your intuition services you as well as your intellect, let your curiosity lead you to understanding in lieu of rational thought alone. THere's more to life than what you were taught.

—description from the publisher

With this module, whenever you gain an Insight, a player can instead choose to advance their chosen personal Fascination. Each time you complete the Fascination track, the player receives the reward on their Fascination board. Thus, the player decides if they wish to pursue their Fascination reward at the expense of pursuing Comprehensions and Breakthroughs.

This module introduces eight Fascination boards. At the start of the game, each player chooses one Fascination board and attaches it to their player dashboard.

boardgame.name: Total Contamination
boardgame.description:
A science outpost on an icy moon. The bio-filter A.I. has mysteriously crashed. One of you has been infected with an alien form that can assume your whole identity. Can the humans reboot the A.I. or make it to the launch vehicle before the hidden infection achieves Total Contamination.

In this game all players begin in human form but one of you is secretly an alien infection that has assumed the guise of one of the humans. During play, infected players may infect others. The uninfected humans struggle to expose and defeat the aliens. The aliens attempt to defeat and contaminate the humans. However if too many humans become contaminated, then the aliens will turn on each other.

The game board represents a small, domed science station on an icy world, with a launch vehicle ready for lift off outside.

At the start of the game there is only one infected card in play. As play progresses more such cards accumulate and infected characters may end up infecting others by sharing to them. Each turn players choose one or two actions (move, combat or a task). The location on the board will make certain tasks available, such as using the bio analysis drone from the drone hub. Other players whose characters are nearby can help, hinder or watch. Cards are played to show how things turn out. When the dust settles the active player also gets to share cards with someone who helped or hindered.

If a player is forced to reveal an infection card in their hand face up, then their character changes from human form (blue) to monster form (red). Monster form can perform fewer tasks but can easily attack and infect others.

The game ends when one of these conditions is met:

the AI is fully reprogrammed using uninfected cards, or with 2 or 3 infected cards giving an infection win
the launch vehicle lifts off. If any character on board is infected that becomes an infection win.
all players are in monster form, which produces an infection win.


If a human victory occurs, all uninfected humans win.

If an infection victory occurs only a limited number of infected players win, as the infection organisms are very competitive.

boardgame.name: Raon: 10th Anniversary
boardgame.description:
To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the most popular Hangul boardgame Raon, Gemblo, inc. published Raon: 10th Anniversary.

It features deluxe components such as a velvet bag and golden color printed tiles. It has more tiles than the base game, so it can be played with up to five people. And the rule book includes total of twelve rules, from the first edition rules to the rules that are newly developed for this edition.

Examples of new rules included in 10th Anniversary edition:

Guess - Select a theme and each player makes a word related to the theme, then players figure out what words the other players made by guessing each consonant or vowel tile.

Connect - Players take turn making a word using their tiles. After the first player makes a word. The following players must use 1 syllable from ‘the previous word’ when they make a new word.

Recombine - This is the rules for Raon championship and any other tournaments.

boardgame.name: Magical Girl Noble Rose
魔法少女ノーブル・ローズ
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Noble Rose transforms into a magical girl who fight off an evil organization's Bio Soldiers to save the women in the city.

It was originally released in Japanese only, and fan translated in 2020 before it was officially released in English in 2021.

boardgame.name: Abandoned
Livestream: Escape from Hotel Izanami
廃深
boardgame.description:
Can the three video distributors escape from the mysterious costume that suddenly appeared
and escape alive from the abandoned leisure hotel?

This work is a side-scrolling action-adventure that aims to escape from the mysterious murder costume that is attacking, exploring the inside of an abandoned leisure hotel and solving the mystery with clues to items and hints.
Their fate changes greatly depending on the actions of the players.

Story
The video distributors Ikoma, Sakurai, and Shiraishi visited the famous local psychic spot "Hotel Izanami" at Sakurai's suggestion, "I want to go to the ruins for shooting ."

Shooting at a common psychic spot that doesn't have a big anecdote.
I wish I could finish shooting without incident and make a horror-like video-that's it.

During the shooting, Ikoma, who was lost alone, is attacked by a costume that suddenly starts to move.
After that, three people are attacked by various crises in a trapped leisure hotel.　

Why did the costume attack three people and why was it trapped in the hotel?
Can he safely escape from this abandoned leisure hotel?

Video distribution that puts a life on the stage of an abandoned leisure hotel begins

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hero Zex
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Zex is mistaken by Eve as being the Blue Haired Hero whom will defeat the Demon Lord from the prophecy after he is lucky to escape imprisonment although he denies to could be the Hero.
Eve decides to travel with him on this quest where they meet the heroine Aruna who is also attacked by demons in the forest.

boardgame.name: Adventurer Liz and the Erotic Dungeon
boardgame.description:
User Summary

To get back the fortune that she has lost, Liz has to enter a forbidden dungeon which is full of monsters.

boardgame.name: Not So Neighborly
boardgame.description:
Not So Neighborly is a fun strategic card game, great for 2-4 players, that takes about 15-30 minutes to play and 5 minutes to learn.

In Not So Neighborly, your goal is to be the first to complete building a neighborhood by collecting a total of 10 build points. But, beware! The other players can prevent you from building your neighborhood by stealing buildings, destroying buildings, and more. So be not so neighborly in order to win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Succubus Runa and the Erotic Dungeon
boardgame.description:
User Summary

As Runa is caught in the rain while heading home, she decides to stop and get a hot bath and a warm bed. However she suddenly finds herself in a strange place.

As she leaves this strange place she is confronted by an old man and his young assistant to become a magical soldier and is forced to fight monsters - that can't be fought with any normal weapons - only with "that"

boardgame.name: Escape Box: Chtulhu
boardgame.description: Through 3 scenarios, with several levels of difficulty, the Escape Game settles in your living room. Hide the clues in your home, and above all, try to solve the riddles to save the world of the Ancient God in less than 60 minutes.

boardgame.name: Ghosts of the Jungle: A Solitaire Wargame
boardgame.description:
3 Squadron of the Australian Special Air Force Service Regiment (SAS) arrived in Vietnam in June 1966. Their objectives were to undertake reconnaissance patrols and to observe enemy movement, as well as to conduct offensive missions deep in enemy territory. They often operated in groups as small as four and moved slowly through thick jungle and bushland. The kill ratio of the SAS was surpassed by no other Australian unit in Vietnam. They were feared by the North Vietnamese Army and the Viet Cong who referred to them as the ‘Ghosts of the Jungle’.
In the game, it’s 1966 and Sergeant Allen, together with Troopers Baker, Clarke and Dixon of the Third SAS Division must undertake covert missions in the jungle of Vietnam, in an area swamped by Viet Cong. Danger awaits as they face numerous enemies and difficult conditions. They will need to use stealth, tactics and good planning to survive.
This is book-based solitaire wargame. You play the game, and the book will provide the “enemy”.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Nightmare [RPG]
boardgame.description:
User Summary

RPG by Alice Maid (アリス☆メイド) about Julia, a girl with an incurable disease waiting for a surgery but then is visited by witch who curses her and thereby induce her to the World of Nightmare - and she will return to her own world by defeating the Malignant Tumor...

boardgame.name: 20 sekund challenge
boardgame.description: Two teams, one judge, over 400 crazy challenges and only 20 seconds to not get beat! In the 20 second challenge, players will have the opportunity to try their hand at completing a series of non-obvious, surprising and crazy tasks. The faster you tackle the challenge, the less time you leave for your rivals. An amazing party game that will make you laugh to tears!

boardgame.name: 02 Hundred Hours: Night Raids in World War II
boardgame.description:
02 Hundred Hours is a skirmish wargame focusing on night-time raids in World War II. Inspired by classic war movies as well as historical events, battles are fast paced with roughly 10-20 models on either side.

Field an elite force of Commandos, SAS, Paratroopers or Rangers to infiltrate the enemy lines under cover of darkness. Recruit SOE spies and local resistance fighters to bolster your chances.

Launch attacks on radar stations, munition factories, airfields, bridges and rail lines. Sneak past sentries, take them out with silent attacks, or open fire with a devastating ambush. Plant charges to destroy your objective, assassinate a target or grab vital intel, then fight your way to safety before reinforcements arrive.

Or play as the defenders, carefully setting patrol routes so your sentries can spot raiders in the shadows, utilise guard dogs, officers or even the dreaded Gestapo and make use of informants and intercepted transmissions to thwart the attackers’ plans.

All fighters have a 180 degree field of vision, so cannot see behind without turning. Enemies are not visible in the darkness and must be detected before you can react to them.

The attackers start each mission creeping forward through the night, aiming to stay covert, timing their movement to sneak behind patrolling sentries. If they are careless, or a sentry turns at the wrong moment, the defenders may detect them and grow suspicious, closing in and eventually raising the alarm.

At this point the defenders get reinforcements and can open fire on the raiders! But even then, it is vital to locate enemy soldiers - both sides can only attack foes once they've been spotted!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Simply Foot
boardgame.description:
Defend, defend and defend! Today you are facing the best team in the championship, you have been preparing for this event for long weeks by developing a tactic called The Mega Bus. You suffer but are well fielded in your half of the field, your players in the middle "Cut out" everything that passes and your defenders are well grouped in your area. As a last bastion, your goalkeeper resists, left, right, but begins to wear himself out... You have to hold on! It's up to you to achieve the perfect steering by making the most of your counterattacks?

Throughout the game, your objective will be to protect your goalkeeper's HP as much as possible from opposing attacks and penalties. For this you will play Defense, Middle, Recovery and Special cards. Attackers score goals when your goalkeeper has 0 PV left , but if you can resist attacks , you can counterattack by accumulating dice and score goals.

The game ends when the cards deck is empty and the winner is declared. You win by winning the match!!

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Dungeon Dice Pack
boardgame.description: From publisher: 12 Additional Dungeons Dice to support all player counts and do not have to pass the dice.

boardgame.name: Disney A Goofy Movie Game
boardgame.description:
Global superstar Powerline is back on tour!

In Disney A Goofy Movie Game, you join Max and his friends as they race across the United States, play cards to collect fun memories for their scrapbook, and try to score the best seats by the time Powerline hits the stage — assuming Goofy doesn't botch things up and send you on a side quest.

boardgame.name: Disney Big Thunder Mountain Railroad
boardgame.description: Step off the stagecoach and into the cursed mining town of Tumbleweed in Disney Big Thunder Mountain Railroad. Will you find fortune mining the mysterious mountain — or awaken its many dangers? Each turn, resources spill down the mountain, with you trying to collect those resources to upgrade your mining operation to score more points. Each round features twist-of-fate cards that mess with the environment through dangers like landslides and dynamite.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sagrada: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Compatible with Sagrada, including 5-6 Player Expansion, The Great Facades – Passion, The Great Facades – Life, and the 2020 Promo Pack expansions.
Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.5 x 22.6 x 7.6 cm.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Drop: Treasure Trunk
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's 2020 Kickstarter Page:
As requested and designed in collaboration with the community, this box includes 5 plastic game trays, 6 card dividers and enough space to hold the complete Dungeon Superstructure and up to 3 of our cubical game boxes!

Back of the Box:
"This storage solution is precision designed to store the Dungeon Drop game box (which is intended to hold all available game cards and rules, organized using 7 included card dividers), 2 neoprene Dungeon Mats, a full set of Dungeon Walls, and the 5 included plastic game trays. If you don't own the Dungeon Mats or Dungeon Walls products, you can hold up to 6 cubical game boxes and still include 2 of the game trays. Whatever your preferred configuration may be, all contents will fit perfectly snug!

Contents:
-Treasure Trunk box with built in divider
-7 card dividers
-5 plastic game trays with 2 compartments each

This is not a standalone game."
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tavern Tales: Legends of Dungeon Drop

boardgame.name: Disney Happiest Day Game
boardgame.description:
Visit exciting attractions, meet cherished characters, eat snacks, collect souvenirs, and experience magical moments throughout Magic Kingdom Park in Disney Happiest Day Game. Along the way, you'll share your favorite ways to spend the day. When Tinker Bell reaches the top of the castle, the game board magically transforms from day to night!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge
boardgame.description:
A crate full of unique physical puzzles, and the story of a lost civilization. Solve the puzzles. Find the treasure. Escape the maze.

The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will include hands-on physical puzzles, paper puzzles, mechanical puzzles, ciphers, folding puzzles, logic puzzles, illusions, riddles, and pattern games. We are designing each puzzle ourselves specifically for The Labyrinth, and are placing an emphasis on immersive puzzles with physical objects and unique solutions.

To complete the challenge, you must use clues to solve many smaller puzzles, which will lead to other clues in a larger interwoven narrative. Once you solve the smaller puzzles, you can combine the solutions in order to unlock and solve the overarching meta-puzzles.

Solving all of the puzzles in the Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will provide at least 8-10 hours of puzzle-solving and clue-cracking for a group of 3-4 people. The challenge can be played individually or with a group, and the game includes a huge number of puzzles and associated content. We have designed puzzles that will be accessible to people who have never participated in a puzzle hunt or escape room, as well as puzzles that will challenge even the most experienced puzzle hunters and escape room addicts. Some puzzles will be easily and quickly solved, while others require a more in-depth examination. The complete Labyrinth challenge is designed to provide hours of entertainment and immersion into this unique experience, with a story that unfolds as the puzzles progress.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Nidavellir: Idavoll
boardgame.description:
Idavoll is the second expansion for Nidavellir.
During the 3 first rounds of the Age 1, the second tavern offers Mythical Animals, Aesir, Valkyries, and Giants, which adds an additional round to the game. Each new type of card also adds never-before-seen effects.

Gods: When you recruit a God, put the card in your Command Zone with 1 Power token on it. Discard this token to use the God's power.

Giants: When you recruit a Giant, put the card in your Command Zone and place 1 Capture token at the bottom of the column of the matching class. Each Giant lets you capture a Dwarf of the matching class.

Valkyries: When you recruit a Valkyrie, put the card in your Command Zone with 1 Strength token on the highest notch. Whenever you meet one of the Valkyrie's requirements, move the token down a notch. At the end of the game, earn victory points depending on the position of the token.

Mythical Animals: When you recruit a Mythical Animal, place it in your army in the matching class. Each animal has its own unique ability.

boardgame.name: Con-Struction Save 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Make your own oversized caves for your Save Vs. Cave maps. Set includes walls, floors, holes, cliffs, pillars, and more for cave building. Make your preparations to battle the ca-vay dwellers!

boardgame.name: Great Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three Multi-Section Subterranean Ruin Maps

We’re not talking about just “got a little oil on the sleeve of an old sweater” level of ruin, we’re talking a “marinara and red wine on a full white ball gown” level of ruin!

boardgame.name: Ice Temple Mapper
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Does your crazed ice cult need their own custom digs? Good luck digging in the permafrost!

boardgame.name: Worker's Decor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Over 120 unique tiles, some in two color variations, for all your workin' folks needs. Great for filling out the crafts part of town.

boardgame.name: Something Wild! Star Wars: Boba Fett
boardgame.description:
Something Wild! Star Wars: Boba Fett is a fast-paced, light card game. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs, just like in Rummy. Power cards specific to the included character add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay. The first player to score three powers wins.

You can combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to a game.

boardgame.name: Sewers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sewers

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes: FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format

boardgame.name: Cave Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cave Entrance

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes: FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format (72dpi)

boardgame.name: Something Wild! Marvel Spider-Man
boardgame.description:
Something Wild! Marvel Spider-Man is a fast-paced, light card game. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs, just like in Rummy. Power cards specific to the included character add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay. The first player to score three powers wins.

You can combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to a game.

boardgame.name: Rojo Kumite
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Somewhere in the world, where the lights can’t quite fade the darkness, you sit on the bench, waiting for your turn to enter the arena. The spectators boo you, your opponent despises you. You don’t deserve their applause. You’ve done terrible things to get here, but you can’t stop now. There’s a lot at risk and today you can lose everything. Your lungs fill with air, your hands become fists. You’ve trained a lot and sacrificed everything to get to this moment. Some day you’ll have a sad and lonely death, but today you must survive. The prize is not as important as what you can get with it. You can’t mess this up.

boardgame.name: Love Letter to Lady Luck
boardgame.description:
The King wants to stop the many love letters arriving in the castle. So he arranged for prospective suitors to temporarily come and meet all the ladies to earn their trust. The suitor with the most support from the ladies is permanently allowed inside the castle.

Love Letter to Lady Luck (LLLL) is the sequel to the widely acclaimed game, Love Letter. As it shares the same background world setting, the art and layout is the same as "Love Letter". However, it plays differently from the original.

You bid on cards which you either use as collaborator or score cards. The collaborator cards help you gain better cards or manipulate your own or your opponents' decks. But score cards help you win the game.

You can also play Goita with the same cards.

Released as part of Princess Wonder. It was not released in a separate retail edition.

boardgame.name: Push SRD
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Push is a lightweight, story-driven RPG system designed for cooperative, action-packed adventures. This is a genre-agnostic engine that you can use to create your own games about extraordinary characters embarking on perilous quests through fantastic worlds.

A single core mechanic powers the whole system, pushing the story forward through emergent complications and inviting players to assume higher risks and use their imagination.

The complete absence of stats brings story weaving to center stage and invites beginners and veteran players alike to try a freer, lighter role-playing experience.

boardgame.name: Charlatan
boardgame.description:
Somewhere on the French Riviera:

The town is brimming with wealthy, gullible targets. But too many Charlatans in the same area might ruin this Con Artist oasis. So! Since you all know each other; you’ve agreed to these terms:
Who ever gets away with the most money this summer, gets to have the place for themselves for good.

It’s going to take every trick in the book to pull this off. Every con, scheme and exit strategy you know, must be put to use, if you’re planning on having this oyster for yourself.

Charlatan is a 1-4 player asymmetric take-that/push your luck card game, where each player tries to get away with as much money as possible, while also trying to sabotage their rivals.

Each card is unique and gives the players the option of actually telling a funny story of how they win a Target's trust or getting away with millions, which can make it somewhat entertaining having your target stolen by another player.

Through a combination of different cards; Cons, Long Cons, Combo Cons, Schemes, Arrangements and Exits, you'll scam and swindle your way through to becoming the biggest Charlatan of them all!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cafe Rush
boardgame.description:
A top speed, high energy, family-friendly card game that’s perfect for parties.

Don’t keep your customers waiting; serve the food they ordered as fast as you can!

In this fast & frantic card game, play table cards, then fill their orders by playing food cards onto them. The catch? Everyone can play on anyone's cards, and everyone plays at once!

Serve the most tables and play the most cards overall to score big points and get the "tip jar" bonus!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Octopie
boardgame.description: Octopie is an undersea race to gather eight matching arms for your octopus! Roll the die to see whether you draw from the octo-pile, flip over a tentacle tile to reveal the color lying beneath, or swap with an opponent. Find an arm holding a pie, and you get a tasty extra action to help win the race. Be the first to complete your octopus to win.

boardgame.name: Sleeping Queens 2: The Rescue
boardgame.description:
In Sleeping Queens 2: The Rescue, the Pancake Queen, the Ladybug Queen, and their friends return with some new characters and a new mission: Save the kings!

Play queens to rescue kings from a parade of perilous predicaments. Find a magical companion to aid your quest, but watch out for Wild Gnomes, Sleeping Willows, and the ever-sneaky Switch Witch! Each player has a knight in front of themselves with a special power, but don't get too attached because if anyone rolls a dragon on the die, all the knights move left. Save the most kings and crown yourself the royal hero!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Teeter Tower
boardgame.description:
In Teeter Tower, you work as team to roll dice and stack them on each new level. The challenge is that every tile limits dice placement by color and number. Tiles come in three colors — orange, green, and blue — and they have numbered spaces on them. Each turn, you roll dice and can place numbers only in the matching numbered spaces and colors only on the tile of the proper color where no numbered spaces are.

To win, you need to place all the tiles into a single tower — which is balancing on a small base, mind you, then top the tower with one final tile!

boardgame.name: Chonky Donkey
boardgame.description: Each player in Chonky Donkey has a hand of question cards. In a round, the active player draws a card from the answer deck and reads it out loud. Each other player in turn chooses a question card from their hand and reads it, after which the active player must give their answer without laughing. If the active player succeeds in keeping a straight face, they keep their answer card as a point; otherwise they give it to the person whose question made them break. Play until someone collects the required number of points to win.

boardgame.name: Click! The Great Wall
boardgame.description:
You’re on top of the Great Wall and of course you want to take the best pictures to reminisce back at home! Swap, slide and search the Great Wall to find the best compositions for your pictures. But make sure you’re fast enough, or your opponents might already take the shot!

Click! The Great Wall is a card game where each player receives 'composition' cards. These depict a certain scene that can be formed with ‘wall’ cards. In each turn, the active player will be able to add a wall card to the existing wall and play an ‘action’ card to alter the wall. If an addition to or alteration of the wall results in a composition equal to what a player (doesn’t have to be the active player) has in their own composition cards, or one of the three communal composition cards, that player can yell CLICK to take the picture and complete their composition card. They thereby win points, the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Millennials vs. Boomers
boardgame.description:
Floppies? Beepers? Emojis? Memes? The generational divide is alive and well. See how well you know the generation you love to mock. From tech to tunes to terminology, Millennials and Boomers go head to head in this LOL, pop culture trivia game.

Not a boomer or millennial? Not to worry, this is a game every generation can play.

Perfect for trivia night, family game night...or any night.

boardgame.name: Birthstone
boardgame.description:
Birthstone is a competitive board game that takes place deep in the heart of the bustling Sulperra Market. In the game, players take on the role of artisan jewelers who bid against one another for precious gems, metals, and reagents in order to craft valuable artifacts for the wealthy elite.

Players take turns placing their apprentice tokens (workers) on various locations on the game board to take a variety of actions, including bidding, mining, and reagent procurement.

The game ends when the last of the commission cards is completed, and the player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aton-Rezi's Profetia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Finallagen utses i de två kvalomgångarna av vilka man kan ange den som passar bäst samt vilket lag man vill spela i på föranmälan.

User summary:

7-page print-and-play handouts

boardgame.name: Bakom Spegelporten
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ett lag består av 7 personer, 6 spelare och 1 DM. Laget måste ha en DM, annars får laget inte spela.

boardgame.name: Beirut Blues
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kung Shartock av Muura dotter, Elwi, aka gifta sig med Fhilyb, kronprinsen av Karr, för att stärka de båda länderna mot den gemensamma fienden det ondskefulla landet Ryyfh som styrs med järnhand av den storhetsvansinninge kejsar Gadukh XI.

boardgame.name: Bem's Blues (Beirut Blues Part 2)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Den text som följer behandlar den undre nivån av grottsystemet i Talahan den ondes Berg räknat från det stalle dar Riddlern befinner sig.

boardgame.name: Det Första Äventyret
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

För länge sedan ägde Pokéthulherna världen men de tappade greppet om den då människorna kom och sedan dess har många av de äldre thulherna gjort allt för att åter regera. En av dessa Pokéthulher är den uråldrige K´thu-too, denne Pokéthlulhu har de senaste åren varit på jakt efter en av världens äldsta Pokénomicons, Den Döda Boken(DDB). Det har nu kommit till K´thu-toos vetskap att DDB är första pris i Shudde Mall´s årliga Pokéthulhu tävling, med sina mystiska krafter har K´thu-too tagit över Team Eibon för att stjäla DDB. Om K´thu-too skulle få tag på boken så har han kraften att kontrollera de vanliga Pokéthulherna t.ex. Pikathulhus och Starspawn. Med en arme av Pokéthulhus kan K´thu-too erövra världen och frigöra alla Pokéthulher som människorna har tillfångatagit, och krossa människorna en gång för alla.

boardgame.name: All the Weapons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Over 200 magic weapons of every variety.

boardgame.name: Arcadian Arbitration
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Fae magic is all about making a deal. But not every deal needs to be signed in blood and written into the cosmos. Sometimes, reality itself can be convinced to bend just a little, giving up a small amount of its stability to the influence of Arcadia.

boardgame.name: Countess von Zarovich
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tips and tricks for running the she-devil Srahd.

boardgame.name: Evil Incorporated: 10 Pentex Subsidiaries
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Pentex is not, strictly speaking, a company. Pentex is a huge network of interlinked companies that are joined together through both formal and informal networks, bent toward similar goals. There is no stock market entry for “Pentex” used by traders, and it isn’t a single conglomerate one can buy stock in, or get a job working for. Rather, it is a hydra made of capitalism. It bears a thousand names, and every time someone manages to shut one connected company down, it seems like two more rise to take its place before the market opens on the next business day.

boardgame.name: Wyrd Tides
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Inside you'll find:

Eight new kiths
Three water-related True Fae
New Contracts

boardgame.name: Library Cats
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a clowder of magical house cats tasked with keeping a magical library safe and helping its patrons—so long as those patrons aren’t planning to end the world. But something terrible is about to happen!

boardgame.name: Doctor Who: The Role Playing Game Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher's blurb:

"The award-winning Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game has regenerated into a new Second Edition that is faster, easier, and even more exciting. This book presents all the rules and background you need to voyage across space and time with the Doctor, or as new characters experiencing brand new epic adventures.

This core rulebook includes:


Complete character creation rules to allow you to bring to life a new time travelling adventurer to explore space and time aboard the TARDIS. They could be companions to the Doctor, or a new Time Lord of your own creation, Time Agents, or investigators and defenders of planet Earth.
The complete revised rules for playing Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game. The new and updated version of the popular Vortex system is completely compatible with the First Edition of the game. Second Edition makes gameplay faster, easier, and quicker to learn, while keeping all of the dramatic action you’d expect from an episode of Doctor Who.
Advice for Gamemasters, new and old, on how to make the experience of Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game feel like you’re living an episode of the TV series, as well as how to create exciting storylines and continuing campaigns.
Revised rules for creating your group’s own TARDIS, or other time travel device to allow them to adventure from the dawn of history to the very ends of the Universe.
An expansive look at the history of the Universe, detailing many of the aliens and creatures the Doctor has encountered across space and time.
Pregenerated character sheets for the Doctor and her companions, ready to play straight away!"
boardgame.rpg: Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Second Edition

boardgame.name: Doctor Who: The Role Playing Game Second Edition - Starter Set
boardgame.description:
From publisher's blurb:

"Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Starter Set contains everything you need to start your adventures across all of space and time. Whether you’re a complete beginner at roleplaying games or looking for an epic new campaign, this boxed set is the perfect starting point for anyone wanting to experience the vast universe of Doctor Who.

The Timeless Library is a brand new adventure for players of all experience levels. It sends a group of new and varied companions on a journey to a vast library filled with dangerous artefacts and even more dangerous invaders. The story continues in the epic campaign The Echo Chamber and a quest to recover The Hermit’s Lantern, providing new and established characters a wealth of adventure that will take them to surprising new worlds.

Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Starter Set includes:

Read This First! introduction sheet

5 ready-made characters

The Timeless Library adventure book

The Echo Chamber campaign book

2 rules reference sheets

60+ Story Point tokens

An exciting new adventure that teaches you the rules as you play.

Over 100 pages of introductory rules and fantastic adventures across space and time."
boardgame.rpg: Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Second Edition

boardgame.name: CookPot!
boardgame.description:
The best chefs are in the town.
But the best cannot be many!
Cooking competition was held to determine the superiority!
In addition to cooking skills, you need "a little bit" of luck to win.

Gather ingredients!
Use cooking tools!
Treat guests!
Be the best chef!

There're 5 cooking ingredients. Meat, Fish, Vegetable, Wheat, Rice. You can get these ingredients with cards or dice. Draw an 1 card or roll 2 dice. The cards belong to the individual, and the dice belong to everyone. Therefore, only roll the dice when you are sure!

If someone makes 5 dishes, game ends. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Deviation
boardgame.description:
Path building game that uses tile placement with color coordinated line segments to move totems, with the objective to move the opponent to a designated "kill spot".

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Tin Star
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A town called Mercy. A law dog and and outlaw. And a legacy of sin to be paid in blood.

Tame the Old West with this unique, single-player story game. Tell a new story every time with simple card play mechanics. Draw a card, consult the look-up tables and discover the truth about the sherriff, the outlaw and the people caught inbetween.

boardgame.name: The Witch's Almanac
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Witch's Almanac is a solo exploration game, where you play as a witch who has been practicing potion making. The potion you’ve been studying requires two key components, and this potion can only be brewed under the light of the Pink Moon. You need to journey out to find these components, return home, and brew your potion before the Pink Moon sets. Will you be successful, or will you run out of time?

boardgame.name: The Emissary
boardgame.description:
In The Emissary, you are a young noble sent by your father to gather support from eight neighboring kingdoms. In each kingdom, you engage in a series of debates with their ruler. Using the right amount of force and deference, you must win exactly a certain number of debates per kingdom. Succeed and you may call upon the ruler for future support; fail even once and lose the game.

The Emissary is a solo trick-taking game playable with a deck of regular playing cards, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series. The game begins by arranging the deck's eight kings and queens in a row. The player then "visits" each card, in whatever order they choose, drawing a new hand of eight cards from the remainder of deck at each stop. They then draw cards one at a time from the deck, forming the basis of tricks, which the player answers from their own hand. The catch is that whatever place the king or queen being "visited" by the player is (e.g., 1st place through 8th place), that's how many tricks must be won by the player -- no more, and no less. With only a limited capacity to bend the rules through special abilities, the game becomes an exercise in careful hand manipulation and excruciating trade-offs.

The game is inspired by the decktet game Gongor Whist, which itself was patterned from the standard-deck card game Oneonta Whist. This game also holds the core for the free print-and-play game For Northwood!, which swept top prizes in the 2021 BGG 54-card contest. Familiarity with trick-taking games will make understanding the following rules a breeze. Of course, prior knowledge isn't strictly necessary.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: For Northwood! A Solo Trick-Taking Game

boardgame.name: Dying Light: The Board Game
boardgame.description: Dying Light: The Board Game brings the world of the video games Dying Light and Dying Light 2: Stay Human to the tabletop as an epic-scale board game.

boardgame.name: Skyway
boardgame.description:
In Skyway, you are a city planner in charge of designing a notoriously convoluted traffic interchange. Over three passes through the deck, you will be drafting stacks of cards from a random market, which you’ll place into a 3x3 grid. However, each grid cell may only be stacked three cards high - any more and the bottom cards get discarded. Your aim is to create a path of at least 5 increasing cards for each of the four suits.

Skyway is a solo pattern-building game playable with a deck of regular playing cards, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series. On each turn, the player deals stacks of cards to a market, and then chooses one stack to build inside a 3x3 grid. Over three passes through the deck, the player tries to construct the grid in such a way as to create a five-card sequence in each suit -- a pathway formed by the cards that can snake around or intersect with the other suits' pathways. The catch is that each square on the grid can only hold a stack of cards three high, and placing the one card needed to complete one pathway may very well cause a card crucial to another pathway to be discarded.

Arranging tiles to create maps is a cornerstone of many great city-building games like Suburbia and Sprawlopolis. However, most games of this genre require more information on each card than a simple rank-and-suit system can provide. Skyway takes its cue from the Decktet game Aucteraden. By allowing a single space to have more than one “suit” on it, the paths can intersect and weave around each other to create a small, tight puzzle.

boardgame.name: Loot the Loop
boardgame.description:
You are the dashing adventurer Maxx Delver, currently exploring the long-hidden Temple of the Sun. The temple is filled to the brim with trinkets and traps, but you're most interested in the four royal jewels said to lie within.

The temple you’re raiding is shaped like a closed loop (i.e., a donut), and the top card represents your physical location within it. On each turn, you "move" through the temple, always forward, by moving cards from the top to the bottom of the deck. You can choose to explore (use a number card in either the top of the deck or second-from-the-top to move as many cards as its value from the top of the deck to the bottom), look around (turn over two top cards IF the top card is currently not revealed), mark a path (place the top card from the deck in a reserve pile, IF it is a number card), or return to a marked path (return a card from the reserve pile to the top of the deck). Exploring and landing on a treasure makes you LOOT it, both adding to your score and thinning the deck to increase the density of traps (face-up court cards)! If exploration ever results in wandering into a trap, it's game over. You win once you get all four jewels and land on the exit.

Loot the Loop is a solo adventure game playable in-hand with a deck of regular playing cards, inspired by other in-hand games such as Maiden's Quest and Palm Island, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series.

boardgame.name: Riot Quest: Arena Miniatures Game
boardgame.description:
The once-great Iron Kingdoms are now a pile of smoldering ruins, and there's treasure everywhere if you've got the gumption to fight for it! You'll need a crackerjack crew, gobs of gear, and lots of love for the chaos of battle if you're going to score the best leftover loot in the land — but it's every human, dwarf, elf, and goblin for themselves in this outrageous quest for bodacious booty!

Riot Quest is a fast-moving, highly unpredictable skirmish board game using hobby miniatures. First released in 2019 using hobby miniatures, Riot Quest has enjoyed three years of expansion and growth. The new board game edition will include 48 preassembled plastic miniatures and all the dice and accessories needed to play the game with up to four players.

boardgame.name: Riot Quest: Pe(s)ts Expansion
boardgame.description: The Riot Quest: Pe(s)ts Expansion features 24 miniatures, with six different pets in four colors. Pets are actually riot gear with corresponding minis that get placed on the board with your heroes, providing a bevy of wacky antics to drive your opponents crazy while helping you score more loot and bounties.

boardgame.name: The Bone Place of Dreib
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

You are alone. It is dark. You have never read a book.

There is something in here with you.

On a hill above a deserted road there is a rocky crown, and in that crown is the Bone Place of Dreib, and in the Bone Place (so you have heard) is a temple of the ancients full of treasures wondrous and diverse. Why it is unlooted and undefiled? Probably the stories about the place, the ghosts that come if you sleep too close, and the list of grave-robbers who never came back.

But the stories are probably bullshit, the ghosts probably just nightmares, and the grave-robbers rank amateurs. You are don’t care about that shit.

And you have this dream every night. A dream that you are alone, that it is dark, and that you have never read a book. You are down there in the earth and there is something in there with you. It is a million years old and it is not your friend.

boardgame.name: Village Rails
boardgame.description:
In the sleepy English countryside, life continues undisturbed as it has for centuries. It is up to you to travel to every corner of this land, bearing the promise of modernisation, accommodating the oddly specific demands of the locals, and ushering in the age of steam.

In Village Rails, you will be criss-crossing the fields of England with railway lines, connecting villages together, and navigating the complex and ever-changing demands of rural communities. Connect stations and farmsteads to your local network while placing your railway signals and sidings ever so carefully. Meet the exacting standards of cantankerous locals planning strangely specific trips, and weigh their demands against your limited funding. There is much to balance in this tricky tableau-building card game of locomotives and local motives.

boardgame.name: Sailor Moon Crystal: Imposterous
boardgame.description:
The Deathbusters have captured someone from the Sailor Guardians team and replaced them with a Daimon imposter! By asking the team members questions and seeing whose answers don't align with the rest of the group, the team can unmask the imposter and direct the rescue of their captured teammate before it's too late.

In Sailor Moon Crystal: Imposterous, players take turns asking intriguing and open-ended questions related to the Sailor Moon Crystal series. Each player writes down an answer that they think will match the answer given by other players. The more answers a player has in common with the others, the more points they receive. The suspicious player with the fewest points each round, i.e., the one whose answers are most dissimilar from those of other players, might be the imposter and their pawn moves down the game board.

When a player — or multiple players! — exit the last space (Level 6) of the game board, the game ends with the imposter(s) having been revealed. All the remaining players win the game and rescue their captured teammate!

listing.notes: Title: Sailor Moon Crystal: Imposterous Publisher: Japanime Games Language(s): English

G.I. JOE Mission Critical uses the Guardian System, providing a tense, challenging, and co-operative gaming experience.

boardgame.name: Golden Ei
boardgame.description:
Can you get the bunny trio to the Golden Ei inn before the fox catches up to them?

In Golden Ei, you win or lose together. To set up, shuffle the 28 double-sided trail cards, flipping half the deck repeatedly to randomize which sides are face up, then lay out the cards in a trail with the Golden Ei inn card at one end and the Fox at the other. Place the bunnies 8-10 spaces away from the fox depending on how difficult you want the game to be, with each bunny on their own card.

To start, roll the die, then move the matching colored bunny (blue, red, yellow) forward one space. Next, choose the closest vacant trail card either in front of or behind the bunny just moved, then flip it. If the card shows 1-2 eggs in yellow, red, or blue, move the matching bunny forward 1-2 spaces, then once again flip over the closest vacant trail card either in front of or behind the bunny just moved. If you instead reveal 1-3 fox paws, move the fox forward 1-3 spaces, then pass the die to the next player, who rolls the die to start a new turn.

If the fox lands on a bunny, you lose, but if any bunny first lands on the inn, then they all reach safety!

Golden Ei includes six helper cards, such as a dice squirrel and a taxi stork, that you can add to the game. You start only 6-8 spaces away from the fox, but each helper animal provides a one-time benefit that will ideally keep you out of the fox's jaws.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 6+
GOLDEN EI - Kein Sonntagsspaziergang! Ihr seid Hasen auf dem Weg zum Gasthaus "Golden Ei". Doch ein hungriger Fuchs folgt euch. Kommt er näher, steigt die Spannung! Gemeinsam versucht ihr die rettende Alarmglocke am Gasthaus zu erreichen. Reicht der knappe Vorsprung?
Golden Ei ist ein kooperatives Spiel. Inklusive einer kleinen Helferlein-Erweiterung: Dann stehen euch Bienchen, Taxi-Storch, Libelle und Würfel-Hörnchen bei.
Inhalt: 35 Spielkarten 3 Holzhasen 1 Holzfuchs 1 Farbwürfel
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Dark States: Seeker's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark States is a setting for the Savage Worlds rule system that is one part near-future dystopian horror, two parts conspiratorial mystery solving and three parts saving the world from abominations by shooting it in the face!

The Dark States Seeker’s Guide provides everything you need to know to combat a darkness in the dystopian future. Become a soldier in the fight against monsters that dwell on the edge of perception and uncover vast conspiracies that underpin human civilisation in the twenty-first century.

boardgame.name: Dark States: Conspirator's Handbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark States is a setting for the Savage Worlds rule system that is one part near-future dystopian horror, two parts conspiratorial mystery solving and three parts saving the world from abominations by shooting it in the face!

The Dark States Conspirator’s Handbook provides everything you need to run a game within a dark dystopian future where conspiracies are abound.

boardgame.name: Dark States: Gear
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of gear, weapons, and vehicles suitable for the campaign setting.

boardgame.name: Dark States: Player's Background
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 2032 and civilisation on Earth is dying a slow and painful death.

Avarice and fear rules the masses whilst the political establishment crumbles around them.

boardgame.name: Triassic Island
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Triassic Island, the brain child of the eccentric billionaire Dr Fitzwilliam Beacon. A soon-to-be popular attraction filled with dinosaurs, luxury hotels, and gift shops. First, however, he needs to call in the advice of experts to ensure it's safe

boardgame.name: FFXIV World Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This Sourcebook contains spoilers for Shadowbringers expansion and it will contain Endwalker spoilers, if you have not yet completed the Main Story I recommend playing through that first. There were some plot elements that were introduced in that expansion that changes the way we fundamentally see the lore. These spoilers also inspired me to create new ideas that GM's can use to use to tell their own version of this story.

boardgame.name: The Vanilla Game
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Vanilla Game is a very simplified "OSR" implementation. The game has two classes - Fighter and Magic-User - and uses level increments based on experience point accumulation.

boardgame.name: Santa Claus Game
boardgame.description: They race around Santa's Workshop trying to load their sleigh with 5 toys. Once a Santa has 5 toys, they fly off to the town to deliver the toys. Along the way, Santas encounter fun activities like belting out their best "HO HO HO" or Singing their favorite Christmas carol. The first Santa to deliver all their toys wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Kingdom
boardgame.description:
This is an adventure game, where the heroes are wandering around the Kingdom and facing challenges. They receive victory points for solving problems and dealing with monsters. Every completed challenge releases a memory piece from the Mine of Memories and helps the heroes to restore the forgotten Kingdom. The revealed memories reduce the difficulty of further challenges and earn extra victory points for the heroes.

The heroes’ task to get all the memories back from the mine and assemble the forgotten cities on the board to break the evil spell. Players do this by moving up to 3 spaces on the hexagon grid during their turn and either resolving tile events by playing their cards or placing their Memory Tiles to gain points. The player who has the most points at the end of the game is the ruler of the Kingdom and wins the crown.

boardgame.name: Candy Land: Ice Cream Party
boardgame.description:
Players cooperate to stack toppings onto a balanced Ice Cream dish. If the last piece is added to the dish, all players win, however, if it falls over, the player whose turn it was loses.

If playing solo, see how many toppings you can add before the dish falls over.

boardgame.name: Western Legends: Big Box
boardgame.description:
The Western Legends Big Box is more than just a box, its also a complete wooden storage solution that holds every single item (except the playmat) from the Western Legends series. Contents vary with version purchased.

The Alllll In version includes all upgraded components, the hardcover rulebook and stores all game boards as well! It also comes with unique never before seen character cards and a legendary item!

The New In Town version has a softcover rulebook and does not include playmat and some of the component upgrades.

boardgame.name: Cuius Regio: The Thirty Years War
boardgame.description:
In May 1618, two imperial regents of the Habsburg Empire, along with their secretary, were thrown from the window of the council room in Prague Castle for violating an agreement that protected Protestant religious rights. The act, known as the Defenestration of Prague, marked the beginning of 30 bloody years of warfare—the Thirty Years War.

Cuius Regio explores the operational military aspects of this pivotal period in European history and focuses on the maneuvers and battles that shook Europe for three decades.

The game includes scenarios covering the Bohemian Revolt, the Danish intervention, the Swedish intervention, the French intervention, and a Thirty Years War campaign of 31 turns lasting from 1618 to 1648. Each scenario has a unique character, and the game can be played in as little as an hour and a half (for a short scenario) or can be a multi-session game for the full campaign.

The turns are divided into two seasons (summer and winter), and each turn has a variable duration that depends on the number of armies activated. In addition, armies can conduct operations several times but become less effective as they accumulate fatigue during each action.

Combat is an integrated system for field battles and sieges and is resolved by a die roll, modified by each army's leadership, composition, and condition, on a simple Battle Results Table.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chopping Block
boardgame.description:
Chopping Block is a fast paced card game for junior- and mid-level executioners where you need to outbid your unscrupulous coworkers for the juiciest contracts in town. If you're lucky you'll even have time for a cup of your favorite hot beverage.
Probably coffee. Definitely coffee.

The game is a card game for 2-5 players with bidding mechanics and cut-throat player interaction to gain the most gold. You gain gold and influence by fulfilling contracts for executions of various nobles (and other unfortunates….). You can spend both Gold and Influence during the game to get benefits or sabotage your executioner colleagues' work. The player with the most gold at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Vanksford
boardgame.description:
Hundred of years ago the world was dominated by six races: Humans, Dwarfs, Drakes, Beasts, Elves and Orcs. They control their own kingdoms briefly knowing the existence of the others. Until the big calamity falls in their kingdoms destroying their places and turning it uninhabitable. One traveler called Vanksford discovered a huge and prosperous land, not ruled by anyone, the rumor traveled all over the six destroyed kingdoms, and since then all the empires started a war for the lands of Vanksford.

Vanksford is a 2 to 6 player, based on strategy and luck none will be out of this board game, you could play it as teams or not, making it playable for all the family. Per turn every player will collect the materials based on the dice throw, move the troops and realize attacks against other players.

boardgame.name: King of New York: King of Tokyo Power Up!
boardgame.description:
It's chaos in New York!

With these new printable Evolution cards, you can now play as any King of Tokyo monster in King of New York!

Includes: Cyber Kitty, Meka Dragon, Space Penguin, Alienoid, The King, Pandakai, Gigazaur.


King of New York: King of Tokyo Power Up! Print N' Play expansion adds King of New York Evolution cards for King of Tokyo monsters, and differs from the other Power Up! expansions on the following:

King of Tokyo: Power Up!: added Evolution cards for King of Tokyo monsters.

King of New York: Power Up!: New King of Tokyo and King of New York Evolution cards for King of New York monsters to be used in King of Tokyo.

boardgame.name: You Win
boardgame.description:
You Win is a massive multiplayer card game for larger parties, events, and conventions. Players start with an equal number of You Win cards each (at least 1) and face off in quick 1 vs 1 games. The winner, determined by a couple of card flips, will take up to as many cards as they played from their opponent (while keeping any cards they played). The player with the most cards at the end of the event wins the whole game. But players don't know how many cards are in the pool, how many cards other players have, or how many cards to play against each opponent.

The game can be played in-hand, in less than a minute, while standing or waiting. It's an ideal ice breaker game with player choice, luck, and exciting tie breakers. All the rules are on the card.

You Win is a massive multiplayer card game and is distributed as a Forever Free Print and Play Game for personal use.

boardgame.name: Nightreign
boardgame.description:
What horrors lurk where the sun never rises?

The place is 18th-century America. The time is midnight. It's always midnight . . . in the Nightreign. GURPS Infinite Worlds: Nightreign is a horror setting that pits a fledgling country against the forces of darkness. Do you join sides with Grand Inquisitor Thomas Jefferson and his questionable-but-disciplined mages? Protect the countryside as highly trained Rangers? Cross the Creeping Wall that envelops the land as death-defying Bleak runners? Or do you just try to survive one more day?

Nightreign reveals a rich background history (including secrets that players dare not read), guidelines for creating local heroes, insight into bringing this worldline into the Infinite Worlds setting, and tips for getting the tone and theme right in adventures. It also provides information about unique ways magic manifests in this setting, how technology has diverged, and what kinds of threats adventurers could face. A new era has dawned, but so has a new dusk. Can you persevere in the twilight?

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: Opus: Starsong
boardgame.description:
Echo of Starsong is a visual novel style adventure game. Asteroids emitting a sound known as "Starsongs" have become the center of conflict for the immense power they hold. Determined to claim asteroids of his own, a young man ventures out with a girl who can imitate starsongs, lending her voice to unravel an ancient myth deep in the heart of space.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Babble Royale
boardgame.description:
Somewhere, deep in the Siberian wilderness, 26 letters play a deadly game of survival.

Babble Royale is a game of high-speed, word-based combat. You are the last word you made. Eliminate an opponent by quickly connecting your word to theirs, before they do.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – Fishing Boat promo card
boardgame.description:
Adds 10 extra Fishing Boat cards to the game, with their own ability to score extra points.

The designer added it into the Kickstarter version He also added it to the rulebook in the KS version. It was added after the game was finished.

boardgame.name: Crucible Magazine (Issue 0 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crucible Magazine is an exciting monthly full colour magazine available in digital and print made for the fifth edition of the world’s greatest tabletop roleplaying game!

Taking our cues from the magazines of the past, but putting in our own modern twists, each issue will contain over 80 pages ram packed with unique game ready content for the whole table!

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Ms. Marvel
boardgame.description:
Kamala Khan was once a normal Pakistani-American girl in New Jersey who had an obsession with the career of Carol Danvers, a.k.a. Captain Marvel. When she was a teenager, a cloud of Terrigen Mists fell on the Jersey Shore, and she was accidentally exposed. When she awoke from Terrigenesis, Kamala discovered she had morphogenetic power that allowed her to alter her appearance, regenerate from injuries, elongate her body, and alter her mass at will.

Out of respect for her hero, Kamala took up the mantle of Ms. Marvel. She adds her strength to groups of heroes like the Avengers, where her idealist attitude and encyclopedic knowledge of heroes comes in handy... not to mention the smackdown of her embiggened fists.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mordo & Ancient One
boardgame.description:
Baron Karl Mordo learned his impressive magical ability by training with the Ancient One. He has long been one of Doctor Strange’s greatest foes. Baron Mordo has consorted with darker powers like Dormammu and the demon Mephisto in his efforts to destroy the Ancient One and the Sorcerer Supreme.

Born more than 500 years ago, the Ancient One was a mortal inhabitant of Kamar-Taj, a hidden mountain village. The Ancient One learned how to unlock the mystical power of the universe to work magic. Having seen firsthand the dangers of magic if used for personal gain, the Ancient One became the first Sorcerer Supreme. As one of the most powerful magic wielders in the world, the Ancient One has sworn to protect the world against evil magic and those who use it.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rival Panels: Spider-man Vs. Doctor Octopus
boardgame.description:
Take the famous rivalry between Spider-Man and Doctor Octopus to the table with the new Rivals Panels: Spider-Man Vs. Doctor Octopus character pack! In addition to being a brilliant scientific mind and ace freelance photographer, Peter Parker is the amazing Spider-Man, a hero who gained incredible superpowers after being bitten by a radioactive spider. Swinging through the streets of New York on his web lines and wall-crawling his way to the scene of a crisis, Spider-Man arrives just in time to stop the plots of his nefarious foe: Doctor Otto Octavius!

The man now known as Doctor Octopus was once a driven, ingenious researcher who graduated from M.I.T. at the top of his class. An accident while handling radioactive materials fused tentacle-like metal appendages to his body and damaged his mind, warping him into a twisted criminal mastermind and foe of Spider-Man.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Escape from Sin's Curse
boardgame.description:
In Escape from Sin's Curse, it is the year 2911 and the Earth is a desolate wasteland, both physically and spiritually. You are part of a group of scientists trying to figure out where everything went wrong.

Searching through an ancient library, you discover the Bible, which has been lost for centuries. After reading the story of Adam and Eve, your team of scientists decide to take a time machine back to the Garden of Eden to stop Adam and Eve from eating the forbidden fruit and putting a curse on all mankind.

Arriving on the scene just moments too late, you find yourself on a fact-finding mission to discover if there is any way to reverse sin’s curse.

Escape from Sin's Curse is an easy to learn escape room game with the cards slowly introducing players to new puzzles as the team progresses. As the team travels through time to different Biblical events, players will need to look up relevant Biblical passages to solve some of the puzzles that appear. Once Escape from Sin's Curse is solved, the team may give the game to another group since the game is reusable!

boardgame.name: Solitaire Legends: Tiger Lily
boardgame.description:
Solitaire Legends is a series of traditional-style solitaire card games based on popular myths and legends.

Tiger Lily is a solitaire game based on Peter Pan that can be played with a traditional deck of cards. The game was created by Jonathan Auffarth in 2022.

Long gone are the days of Captain Hook and the boy who wouldn’t grow up. Now, pirates battle for control over Neverland, and the Fairy Kingdom is enslaved. Their pixie dust is harvested as a weapon of war. Alas, a new hero rises. All aboard the Jolly Roger as Queen Tiger Lily leads the Lost Boys to free the fairies once and for all!

In Tiger Lily, you must take control of the Jolly Roger. To do so, Find and align 3 Lost Boys (J) in a vertical, horizontal, OR diagonal line. On your turn, play a card from your hand, resolve the action, and then draw back up to 4. Catch Fairies along the way, fight Pirates, and look out for the Crocodile lurking in the water below!

For more games in the Solitaire Legends series check out Guinevere and Maid Marian!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

boardgame.name: Nebel über Carcassonne
boardgame.description:
Nebel über Carcassonne (Fog over Carcassonne) is a co-operative version of the well-known tile-laying game Carcassonne. Working together, you place tiles and score points while trying to stop the spread of ghosts, contain haunted ground in cemeteries, and use haunted castles to your advantage. If too many ghosts are loose on the ground or you've collected too few points when the tiles run out, you lose the game. If you do manage to survive three days, you can adjust the difficulty level of the game to increase the challenge.

Nebel über Carcassonne includes 45 meeples in two new types and 60 tiles that match the graphics of the 2021 edition of Carcassonne, and this game includes rules for how to incorporate material in a regular competitive game of Carcassonne.

boardgame.name: Roll 'N' Wrestle: Territories
boardgame.description:
Roll'N'Wrestle is a modern day twist on the 1950-1980 Wrestling era with you taking the role of a pro wrestling promoter.

The United States of America is divided into territories and you must conquer these by hosting wrestling events and attracting fans to your promotion.

Lead your wrestling franchise to success and beat the competition by recruiting, training, and developing a winning roster of wrestling superstars.

You will roll dice acting as your road agents to complete worker placement strategic maneuvers for your promotion, plus deal with superstar egos, backstage rivalries and locker room politics, negotiate deals with TV networks and sell merchandise to your hopefully increasing loyal fan base! Plus so much more...

Do you have what it takes to beat ruthless rival promotions
and conquer the world of Professional Wrestling?

Come and try in Roll'N'Wrestle: Territories the pro wrestling board game.

boardgame.name: Smoki
스모키
boardgame.description:
You create your dreams and visit dragon realms that take different forms. In some realms you will also meet ravens - you can use their special abilities. They will allow you to change your dreams and the dreams of your rivals! The winner is the player who visits the most beautiful lands in his dream and earns 3 dragon tokens.

Each player has 6 cards in front of them, but initially cannot see what cards they have. Each round the players exchange their hidden cards for uncovered ones from the deck. When one of the players reveals all 6 of their cards, the round ends and the player who has the lowest score on their cards wins a dragon token. The game ends when a player wins by collecting 3 tokens.
