boardgame.name: Sayū
boardgame.description:
Sayū is an abstract strategy tile-laying, tile-flipping for two players. It is played with 49 unique two-sided octagonal wooden tiles and uses no board. The objective of the game is to have more tile of your color face up when all the tiles are placed.

To setup the game place the home tile at the center of the table. This tile has no arrows. From now on no tiles can be placed further than 3 spaces away from this tile (this creates a 7 by 7 grid when finished).

Players then take alternate turns. On your turn you must choose a tile that is still available and place it on an empty space - up, down, left or right of a tile already placed.

You must place it in any of the 8 possible orientations you wish. The orientation of a tile is indicated by the white arrow in the middle.

Once a tile is placed, check whether it can convert an opponent's tile over to your side - to do so you must fulfill three conditions;

1) your tile must have your color arrow pointing toward your opponent's tile
2) the target opponent tile must not have their color arrow pointing back
3) the two tiles must not share the same orientation

If multiple tiles can be converted at the same time you may only choose one.

The converted tile is flipped over to your side and rotated to the same orientation as one that converted it. You then treat that tile as though it just been placed and check if another conversion can be made. Repeat this process until no further conversion is possible.

Now it is your opponent's turn.

Players will take turn placing and converting tiles back and forth in this manner until all the tiles are placed and the game is over. Count up the total number of tiles for each player; whoever has the most of their color facing up is the winner.

boardgame.name: Diuna: Imperium – reDrewno Insert
Dune: Imperium – reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description:
Wooden insert for Dune: Imperium, which will also fit Rise of Ix expansion.

Insert is dedicated to the base game box. The game box closes without lifting the lid. The insert can accommodate cards in premium class sleeves up to 110 microns thick. Insert is constructed in such a way that the lack of the expansion does not affect its functionality.

Insert is available in two versions: Standard and Premium. The Premium version differs from the Standard one in that it has containers covered with plexiglass and the containers have engravings. Both versions fit the base game box.

Insert in the Premium version can be used in the Big Box to store items from the lower part of the plastic tray (markers, tokens, cards). Plastic figures are stored in a dedicated tray from the Big Box. Please note that the box will leave up to 10mm of free space under the lid.

The Empire deck containers can be used as card trays during the game. The token containers also serve as token trays during gameplay. This solution allows for more comfortable gameplay.

boardgame.name: Roll Player: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden insert for Roll Player

boardgame.name: Town Builder: Coevorden – Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
5 promos released as part of the Kickstarter.

Ceremony: 2VP. Building Type - Commerce. Resource Cost - 2
wood. Ability Type - Scoring. Building Ability -
Score 1VP for each judge you did not claim.
Resource - Straw and Stone.

Fields: 6VP. Building Type - Military. Resource Cost - 4
wood. Ability Type - None. Resource - Straw.

Granary: 1VP. Building Type - Housing. Resource Cost - 1

requiring only one more resource. Resource - 1
Straw. Also gives 1 Gold.

boardgame.name: BadNews
boardgame.description:
BadNews is a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity, based on the French YouTube show BADNEWS.

The lead player in turn chooses a News with a blank space, other players must choose an answer with a combination of two different cards maximum (Action or/and Bad) that must be funny.

The game, particularly provocative, is reserved for an adult audience.

boardgame.name: The Artist
boardgame.description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Nicolas Polk was a gifted artist. Even as a student enrolled in Valley Falls University’s prestigious art program, his work always stood head and shoulders above the rest. Fittingly enough, Nicolas was announced as the winner of the annual LaBelle Art Show. Imagine everyone's surprise, however, when the young savant was found dead the next morning inside the art gallery. Can you catch the killer before they get away with a picture-perfect crime?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Black Hole Rainbows
boardgame.description:
Black Hole Rainbows is a board game project that's already been 2 years in the making! It's a relatively fast-playing game that blends elements of chance and strategy together in a way that builds moments of triumph and defeat and kindness and sabotage that are unique to each group of people playing.

The theme is simple: destroy the Universe to save it.

Each Player has their own Black Hole in front of them. Fill that Black Hole with the full rainbow of quantum energy (Light Stones of every color) and it detonates, flinging all those Stones into Outer Space (the common area between Players) and earning you a Supernova Coin. Your Black Hole is now reset (you've moved on to a new part of the Galaxy) and is ready to refill with Light Stones.

There are other ways to earn Supernova Coins, however, as you'll see in the rules regarding the Supernova Roller and the ever-electrifying Cards that might be played. The player with the most coins at the end of the game, wins.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Elden Ring, Black Hole Rainbows, and Eyes : Nonogram - Ep147

boardgame.name: Tech Chess
boardgame.description:
Tech Chess is a two-player, chess variant game where chess pieces each have abilities. It replaces the pieces with a modernized deck of playing cards called the Tech Deck. The cards represent chess pieces on the board each with special abilities. Played on a 6x6 board, each player starts with two kings, a knight, queen, two rooks and 6 pawns that can be upgraded. Players draw 3 cards from the deck at the start of the game. If you like chess, you'll enjoy Tech Chess.

On their turn, a player may do one of the following things, Move a piece, Use card effects, Upgrade a piece, Build a pawn.

boardgame.name: Feats of Cheese
boardgame.description:
In Feats of Cheese, physics and your fine motor skills are put to the test. Players take turns stacking cheese wedges to create tall towers. The taller the tower, the more points you earn. It takes a careful hand and an eye for balance to accomplish this feat.

Stack a cheese wedge on the matching color platform and add a mouse if you can. If you knock over the tower, your opponents score points and you score nothing! To score, players multiply the number of mice in the tower by the number of cheese wedges that match the platform. The player with the most points at the end wins!

boardgame.name: Txek Card Game
boardgame.description:
Pronouce Txek as "check", a reference to our origins: Basque Country across France and Spain.

This is a card game where each player has cards they can - and can't see. The goal of the game is to be the first to discard all your cards by matching the cards on the discard pile. But other players can use special cards to stop you along the way.

Similar game play to UNO but you can't see all your hand at once.

boardgame.name: La Clef: Astolie
boardgame.description:
La Clef is a story driven riddle game, not too far away from series like Unlock or Exit at heart.

The book tell the tales of a fantasy world named Astolie. It is divided in different chapters where the riddles can be solved independently. Solving all riddles of a chapter give hint on solving a final riddle that will unlock the next chapter. The story is divided in 5 chapters with a final riddle once everything is solved.

The riddles revolve around graphical puzzles, word puzzles, and hidden hints. The game also includes an UV light to unveil hidden parts of the story or solutions to some chapters. Hints and riddle happen online via the Author's website and an active Discord community.

The authors claim the story takes about 50 hours to complete when playing with a group of 2-4 people.

boardgame.name: Pluzzables: Destinations
boardgame.description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, two web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" games. You do not have to put the puzzle together exactly in order to play Destinations. However, to play the online Pair Up game, all the pieces must be in their correct positions.

The Destinations edition is a puzzle of vintage travel posters. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players fly airplanes to various locations to collect lost luggage.

Players are given tickets that contain not only destinations, but a variety of actions that can influence movement of airplanes. On their turn, players roll dice, use a ticket, and either move, collect suitcases, or perform an action.

Once all luggage has been collected, the player with the most luggage points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Dose Cards
boardgame.description:
Dose is a wild, drink-giving card game. Players race to play or trade all of their cards. Each card can change the color, advance the game, or make your friends drink. Cards are played on their color, but some cards allow players to trade their entire decks or otherwise change the game dynamics wildly. The winner is the first player to play all the cards.

Similar to UNO, once a player only has two cards, they must shout, "Dose!" before another player realizes it or else they must drink and draw two cards.

boardgame.name: Instruments of the Chrysanthemum Throne
boardgame.description:
From the book introduction:

Explore a world of myth and magic where you must balance the terrible evil of the sentient object you carry, with the enormous power it grants.

Japan is in turmoil. The balance between the natural elements has been shattered; natural disasters ravage the land and monsters from legend terrorise the people.

The greatest heroes of the age have tried and failed to overcome this supernatural catastrophe. Now, in desperation, the Emperor reluctantly unleashes the most potent magical force at his disposal.

The Instruments of the Chrysanthemum Throne are a collection of powerful Tuskumogami, sentient objects that possess remarkable magical powers. They have been locked away for generations because of their abiding malice and hatred of people.

Who will be brave, or desperate, enough to risk their life and sanity by taking up an Instrument and using its power in the service of the Chrysanthemum Throne?

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: Baker's Dozen
boardgame.description:
Baker's Dozen, America's most beloved baking competition show, is in trouble! One of the five remaining contestants is planning to poison one of the judges tonight during the live taping of the show's semi-final. The icing on the cake? If you alert the contestants that you suspect foul play, the killer will have a chance to escape.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Horns Up!: Black Deck
boardgame.description:
An 18+ expansion, whose cards not only include new rules and Paths, but also new Audience cards regarding the less "family-friendly" (and most intriguing and fun) aspects of a concert.This expansion was developed hand in hand with the Lacuna Coil band, asking them about the most awkward and exciting situations happened during their concerts around the world. The result of their tales has become a deck of cards that are extremely... heavy. For this reason, it was decided to pair these episodes with the most “friendship-threatening” game mechanics.

Playing with this deck, you will have the chance to unleash your wrath against a single opponent -loading them with endless debuffs- or spread your evil ways on every opponent. This may call for revenge from your opponents, but keep headbanging and keep your Horns Up!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Adult Versions of Family-Friendly Games

boardgame.name: Namiji: Aquamarine
boardgame.description:
In Namiji, you are two to five fishermen of yesteryear who are about to take a journey of discovery of beautiful and wild marine life. You will need to have a fruitful day at sea to win the game. To do this, you will have the opportunity to contemplate magnificent marine species, to fish with a line or a net to fill your racks with colourful fish and haul in your crustaceans traps.

Aquamarine is the first expansion for Namiji. It contains all the item stretch goals from the original Kickstarter campiagn and a booklet containing the expansion's rules and the Boats' stories. The booklet is also available for download from the Namiji website.

Aquamarine adds the whirlpool and additional creatures to the game. It is an expansion and cannot be played without the base game Namiji.

boardgame.name: Some 'R' Set Remastered
boardgame.description:
The Levi Game Company has remastered this many times played classic - the 1903 original midwestern USA card game, Some 'R' Set. Levi first re-issued this game in 2019.

It plays very similar to Spades or Euchre. But the fact that each suit has a different number of cards, makes the strategy play each round.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Doodle Duel
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Doodle is a two-player roll & write game in which one player takes on the role of Dungeon Lord to design a dungeon behind his player screen, while the other player plays the Hero trying to conquer it.

As Dungeon Lord, roll your dice to draw your Dungeon. Place Traps, Doors, Treasures and Monsters. Protect your Crystals. If you snatch all of your opponent’s Health Points, you’ll win immediately. At the end you will earn Victory Points by protecting your crystals, treasures, and Health Points you have earned from the Hero.

As the Hero, roll your dice to assault your opponent’s dungeon.
Move, fight Monsters, find Keys, and Treasures. If you find your opponent’s 3 Crystals you’ll win immediately. At the end you’ll earn Victory Points for stealing treasures, defeating monsters, conquering Crystals and the Life Points you keep.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Emplumados
boardgame.description:
Emplumados is a card game in which we will be bird watchers and our goal is to get the best score. Keep your cards of different Habitats and of higher value, waiting for the right moment to win a hand... But beware: Depending on the round, some cards can subtract points!

The game of Emplumados consists of 3 rounds.

Players take turns playing hands, and whoever played the best card wins the trick. At the end of the round, the points are counted, and there may be more valuable cards, and others that remain, depending on the score that appears on the Habitat Marker.

After 3 rounds, the total points are tallied and the one with the highest score wins. In case of ties, those players share the victory.


Emplumados es un juego de cartas en el que seremos avistadores de aves y es nuestro objetivo conseguir el mejor puntaje. Guardá tus cartas de diferentes Hábitats y de más alto valor, esperando el momento oportuno para ganar una mano... ¡Pero cuidado: Dependiendo la ronda, algunas cartas pueden restar puntos!

La partida de Emplumados consta de 3 rondas.

Por turnos, los jugadores jugarán manos, y quien haya jugado la mejor carta se llevará la baza. Al finalizar la ronda, se contabilizan los puntos, pudiendo haber cartas más valiosas, y otras que resten, dependiendo el puntaje que figura en el Marcador de Hábitat.

Luego de 3 rondas, se cuentan los puntos totales y aquel con el mayor puntaje gana. En caso de empates, esos jugadores comparten la victoria.

boardgame.name: A New Hope Limited Expansion Set: Star Wars Customizable Card Game
boardgame.description:
The A New Hope Limited set was the first full expansion set of the Star Wars Customizable Card Game. It consisted of 162 cards dividing into 81 Dark Side and 81 Light Side, and was introduced in July of 1996. This set consisted of 54 rare, 54 uncommon, and 54 common cards. This set introduced many of the classic characters from Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, that were not included in the original base set, Premiere Limited. This set also introduced the first epic event cards, such as Commence Primary Ignition and Attack Run, to the game.

Important debuts in this set included Chewbacca and R2-D2. Also of note were the introduction of the Death Star as a system card, the introduction of creatures, and a new mechanic that allowed for the destruction of entire planets.

boardgame.name: Unstable Unicorns for Kids
boardgame.description:
Unstable Games has designed all-new artwork, cards, and characters to delight our littlest gamers while remaining fun and engaging for parents.

Unstable Unicorns for Kids features eight Colorful Unicorn card themes, including Hero, Animal, Princess, Space, Sports, Goofy, Rainbow, and Fantasy. With cards like Sock Puppet Unicorn, Astronaut Unicorn, and Mermaid Princess Unicorn, the game has a unique unicorn (a uniquecorn, if you will) for everyone!

The gameplay consists of drawing unicorns, magical powers and NEIGH! cards into your hand with the goal of being the first player to have 7 unicorns in your stable. Unicorns placed in your stable enable their aligned magic colour cards to be played without having to discard a card like your would normally.

Magic powers range from digging into the deck, swapping hands and stealing opponents unicorns from their stable!

And last but not least, the NEIGH! cards enable you to stop any other players action, even another Neigh card!

boardgame.name: Σινεμαχίες (Movie Battles)
boardgame.description:
A classic board game playing pantomime or answering trivia questions on Greek and International Cinema. In a round metal box (cinematic bobbin), 2 packages of 100 photos, original dashboard, wooden pawns and dice.

The board has a similar use as with trivia games, there is no start and end, but it's purpose is to stop over different frames (places) to be asked different questions about the movie between: "title" by doing pantomime or verbally by looking at the picture, "director", and "actors/actresses". For that, a pawn and a dice are used giving you the option to select the type of questions that you are most familiar with. One side of the card is showing a scene from the movie, while the other has the title, director and actors/actresses involved.

When a movie card is played, the player/team has to answer the question to win it. If he/she/they can't reply then the next player has the opportunity to do so, etc. A movie card never returns to the pile.

The goal is to collect as many movie cards as possible throughout the game. The game ends if all the cards from the deck are finished of when the predefined time has passed. The player with the most cards on hand is the winner.

boardgame.name: Service: Das Taktikspiel der Sparkassen
boardgame.description:
Each player has his own track to move on. Movement is determined by two dice. The players decide to use the sum or difference of both dice to move their meeple forward or backward.

The players have 20 tokens each. If a meeple gets on a space with a "S" the player gets to place 1 or 2 tokens beside that space. On the spaces with a dot he has to place 1 or 2 tokens upside down beside the space.

Instead of rolling the dice a player may turn one arrow token on the track of another player to cause him to have to use the cedit track. Each player can be caused to use each of his two credit tracks only one time. On the credit track only forward movement is possible and the probability of having to place upside-down tokens is higher.

If a player has at least placed 12 tokens front-up, he may go to the "Ziel"-space. When all but one players have reached the "Ziel", the game ends. The player with the most front-up tokens after substracting the number of upside-down tokens wins the game.

This game was published between 1970 to 1983 based on text on the game board.

boardgame.name: The Goonies game
boardgame.description:
You're on the hunt for One-Eyed Willy's fabled treasure with the Fratellis close behind in this immersive cooperative family strategy game! Maneuver your way through the tunnels and around challenges like the Bone Piano to discover the "Rich Stuff" at the end of the journey but only if you can stay ahead of the Fratellis! Bring back your best childhood memories and watch your kids fall in love with this classic adventure movie.

The Goonies Game is here to bring you into the thrilling world of the Fratellis, the Bone Piano, the Goon Docks, and more. Work together to discover the rich stuff at the end of the journey! One-Eyed Willy has his hands on the treasure you are searching for. Solve the challenges with the silver doubloon and the copper bones key to unlock the secrets and find the treasure.

In this game, you work together with the other players to run away from the Fratellis and clear challenges (dice rolls and blind guessing) before they reach you. All 4 groups of Goonies are always in play so these will need to be divided over the number of players. Players play cards on their turn to move (mandatory) and can optionally try challenges (if they're on a challenge space), try to break free from the clutches of the Fratellis (die roll) and play a quote (a one time effect played, unique per card).

The Goonies need to reach the end of the board to win the game, they will also need to have at least 25 'rich stuff' which are found at the end of the board and mostly comes down to blindly taking the correct ones.

boardgame.name: Neptunia x Senran Kagura: Ninja Wars
boardgame.description: Pair up 10 playable characters to slice through enemy hordes, channel the elements, and perform special character attacks.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Heroine of the Year Nominee

boardgame.description: The Cóatl promo deck contains six new Prophecy cards and five new Temple cards. The cards have no text on them.

boardgame.name: Το Τρίγωνο της Γνώσης (The Triangle of Knowledge)
boardgame.description:
A trivia board game for kids

The board is a big triangle with 36 smaller triangles in it. Each triangle has one or two numbers inside.

On his turn, each player first put a pawn in a small triangle of his choice, then draws a card and answer the same number of questions as the number in the triangle. If the answer is correct, he puts a triangle tile in notch and moves to another triangle otherwise it is the turn of the other player.

The game ends when one of the players put all of the triangle tiles of his color on the board or all the 36 triangle notches are occupied.

Every tile gives you 10 VPs. If you shape a hexagon with the same color you take 30 additional VPs. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Final War: Arcane Expansion Set
boardgame.description:
The Arcane Expansion Set weaves in the volatile tempers of the spell-casting Warlords; the powerful Wizard, the hypnotic Witch and the deadly Necromancer. With potent new abilities and devastating spells, get ready for these Warlords to change the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 9-Card Ultima
boardgame.description:
Sosaria has become overrun by evil creatures and the land is in turmoil. The King has sent out an urgent request for the bravest adventurers to help purge this evil from his kingdom and save Sosaria. Those who are brave enough to take up the challenge will be richly rewarded with land, titles and riches. But for those who do decide to take up this gauntlet you must take heed for evil doesn’t just roam the land; it swims deep in the oceans and creeps deep underground within the three dungeons of Sosaria.

Victory Conditions:
You win the game once you complete three quests given by the King of Sosaria to rid the land from the evil that has rising from the darkest dungeons. You must search the land for three magical signposts. Each signpost marks the spot of a magical gem that holds a secret message. There are three signposts holding three gems: Blue, Green, and Red. These magical gems “when deciphered by the King” will give you access to their dungeons. The first quest will be to find the blue dungeon which will be guarded by Beholder. The second quest will be to find the green dungeon which is surrounded by water and guarded by a Minotaur. The last quest and the most difficult will be to find the red dungeon which is surrounded by mountains and guarded by a Balrog demon the most feared evil monster of all. Find the three signposts in order of blue, green and red to recover each gem. Travel back to the King after each signpost to decipher the message in the gem. The King will then tell you where to find the dungeons so you can defeat the monsters within to become the savior of Sosaria.
You lose the game if your health drops to zero or you fail to complete the three quests.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
The most explosive card game! Challenge your friends and be the last one standing.

Kick The Bomb is a party game where players have to throw (kick)/place bombs (remote mines, grenades & nuke) to each other using their cards. Players takes turns using different types of actions (defend, attack, draw a card, detonate) until there is only one player remaining, that player is declared the winner.

The game

boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





User SummarySet in the solarpunk utipia of New London you play as Detective Grosvener hunting down a radicalised serial killer.

You'll traverse New London, but you'll need to enter the addresses as text. Same goes with clues, you'll need to enter those into you enter names of suspects in too.

Cross examine suspects and search for clues to track down the serial killer.

boardgame.name: Locked In: A Marriage Simulator
boardgame.description:
Dating is competitive
Marriage is co-operative
Can you play nice enough to prevent the collapse of your relationship?

Love in the age of coronavirus
Locked In is the first truly two-player visual novel, simulating the breakdown of a marriage during lockdown.

Two sides of the story: Each player controls a character as they argue their case.
Multiple endings: Can you work together to settle the argument in an amicable way for your child?
Real life: Based on interviews with real people in tense lockdown situations, and set in the UK about 3 weeks into a total lockdown.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: You are such a Soft and Round Kitten
boardgame.description:
You are such a Soft and Round Kitten is about a curious kitten. You are so curious, soft, and round, why don't you play and see what you find?

Greetings. This is the world that a kitten can enter. Time to become a kitten. Your only goal is to be soft and round. Relax your vestigial human body. You can feel your hands grotesquely morphing. They are becoming fluffy paws. Yes, you have a sensation of a tail sprouting violently from your. It is getting longer and longer. You have completely become round and can no longer walk on two legs. Try speaking. What's that? I can't understand you. I only hear a kitten's meow. You are completely a kitten. Become a kitten forever because that's your only purpose. You are no longer human. Make sure you are ready for this to happen to you.

) is a game about games.



) is a series of games based on well-known classics and immediately recognizable mechanics. Each game is connected to the next, with a unique win condition you must figure out yourself.


Gameplay features

Bounce a ball
Race tiny cars
Hit a golf ball
Connect a series of pipes
Uncover mines
Eat fruit
Pop colorful bubbles
???
Supports all control schemes (mouse, keyboard, gamepad), but most of the game is easiest with the mouse.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Sealed Estate
boardgame.description:
SEALED ESTATE is psychological horror game, in which you are locked inside by a creature ready to hunt you down, whilst you figure out how to escape from the estate you have been locked inside. who lived here? who are the voices haunting your every step?

What you will find in your exploration:

Lights are not working in the home.
An enigmatic creature hunting you down.
other creatures laying in wait, staring at you.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: HANDMADEDEATHLABYRINTH issue 0
boardgame.description:
HANDMADEDEATHLABYRINTH issue 0 is one of them: an unforgiving little adventure full of monsters that should take about 10 minutes to finish. From start to end, you'll get a specific, singular expression of the dungeon crawl experience; the hero's journey is to descend into the depths, ignoring their fears, and return a different person. What will you find down there?

What you'll find in this handmade death labyrinth
One sword.
One dungeon to crawl that stays the same every time you die.
Anything else you find down there, you keep.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: SLASHER, Interrupted
boardgame.description:
SLASHER, Interrupted is a visual novel, in which you attempt to tell a horror story whilst your girlfriends interrupt with their own ideas. Will you stick to a cohesive plot, or try and please everyone's ideas at once?

Featuring:
7,000 words of lighthearted campfire banter
A branching story with 27 ending combinations
Pet a cat!
Kill multiple characters!
Get roasted for your messy plot choices!

boardgame.name: Always Down
boardgame.description:
10mg is a collection of 10 minute long games.
Always Down is about someone who goes on a journey.

You solve easy puzzles and overcome light platforming challenges as you go Always Down.
The deeper you dissapear into the cave, the more you change.
You can do things you could have never thought to be possible!

... but

is it really worth it?

Always down is a ~10 minute long meditation on change that will stay with you for a long time.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Stroke
boardgame.description:
Your wife has had a stroke. You’ve rushed her to the hospital and the doctors have taken over. What do you tell your son? Do you call her sister? How will you act when someone you love is in the middle of a medical emergency and all you can do is wait?

Features
Experience a dramatic Hospital Waiting Room narrative based on real events
Explore a hospital and interact with multiple characters
Make choices which each result in unique dialogue
Featuring the somber music of Brother Android from the album “In Death, a Dream of Color”
Player Discretion Advised
Stroke contains discussions of mortality, suffering, blood, and hospitalization.

Stroke provides an opportunity to explore these challenging subjects in a safe space and experience catharsis for anyone who has dealt with similarly difficult situations in their lives.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Cover Me In Leaves
boardgame.description:
Cover Me In Leaves is an experimental work of interactive horror fiction, about bright minds, and the end of all things. Fresh out of high school, with no prospects or aspirations, you've remained here in your small town. Everyone you knew and loved has moved on for better things. You're alone. So you get your first tattoo.

And then the trees start calling.

Gameplay feature

A short work of interactive fiction written by (@elliotherriman) — approximately five to fifteen minutes long, based on reading speed.
Unique, beautiful background art by M. Solé (@mnsoleart) and Camber A (@camberdraws).
Haunting music by the wonderful @beetlestench.
Themes of isolation, entropy, and the death of small town America.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Snaaak
boardgame.description:
SNAAAK is a short atmospheric Snakevania.

Traverse a forgotten laboratory while encarnating a formless critter.
Experience a study on snake’s mechanics that explores different takes and turns on the core of its design as you roam through an extensive metroidvania setting.

Smooth Gameplay
An ethereal underground lab filled with mysterious hazards
Evocative ambience and sound design
Non-linear exploration
Full Controller Support

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: ゼバオト (Zebaot)
boardgame.description:
ゼバオト (Zebaot) is a card game from Japan, featuring cat angels. Players are collecting sets using cards in hand and an open draft.

Players draw and discard cards, forming sets and runs as in Rummy. Once each player has formed their hand, they score. Each two of a kind is 1 point, each three of a kind is 3 points, each four of a kind is 7 points, a six-card straight is 5 points and a six-card flush is 5 points.

The start player has a ring from King Solomon, and if they have the most points (or tied) they keep the ring and score 3 bonus points. Otherwise, the ring moves clockwise. The game ends when every player has had the ring, and the most points wins.

Players can draw from the deck, or from the pool, and hold or discard. When a player holds, they put their hand down until everyone is ready to score. Players cannot keep drawing , they are forced to hold finally.

The publisher says:
King Solomon once used many angels to build the temple with the power of the ring given by the archangel Michael. Use Solomon's Ring to create an army of angels stronger than any other player! A card game where cute cat angels fight!

かつてソロモン王は大天使ミカエルから授かった指輪の力により、多くの天使を使役して神殿を建築しました。
ソロモンの指輪を使って、他のプレイヤーより強い天使の軍団を作りましょう！
かわいいネコの天使たちが戦うカードゲームです！
user summary

boardgame.name: Di-Da-Dobble
boardgame.description:
A weird Yahtzee-like toy. Roll your beloved dice, collect cool props like plants, worms, and snacks by opening presents, and climb the ranks on the di da dobble leaderboards!!!

Features

Cool smooth visuals ?
A cute gnome character ?
An original soundtrack consisting of 9 tracks ?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Dukes of Hazzard
boardgame.description:
An extremely fun and rare board game, based on the famous TV series. It was released in Greece during the 80's by Tjitji Toys. It can be played from 2-4 players.
Before start, each player gets 30$ from the bank. Then, everyone in his turn, roll the 2 dices (the usual one and the colorfull one). When you roll the usual one, your move your pawn (General Lee) the exact number on the board. Then you roll the colorfull one and you move the pawn with the police car. The police car can be moved back and forth. When a player reaches a spot where stands another player, he must pay him 5 dollars and stay in the previous spot. When the police car hits another player, the player who has been hitted, must pay 5 dollars to the bank. In case, that a player must pay the bank and he has no money, as a result he returns to the starting point.
Furthermore, when a player reaches a spot with a question mark on it, he must take a card and follow its rules.
The winner is the player who reaches the finish line, with the exact number on the dice.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tang Garden: Big Box
boardgame.description:
Tang Garden with all Expansions (Golden Age, Ghost Stories and Seasons and every other Promo).

The Tang dynasty was considered the first golden age of the classical and now iconic Chinese gardens. Emperor Xuanzong built the magnificent imperial Garden of the Majestic Clear Lake as an homage of life itself and from where he ruled. Players will act as Imperial Garden Designers and they will be called to build the most incredible garden while balancing the elements of Nature.

Tang Garden is a Zen-like game that will take you to the first golden age of China, where players will progressively build a garden by creating the landscape, placing the scenery and projecting their vision through vertical panoramas. During the construction, noblemen will visit the garden to admire the surroundings and the way the natural elements coexist in the most breathtaking scenery humankind has ever laid their eyes upon.

Players will take turns by playing one of the two actions available in the game:

1) Placing tiles and matching the elements to increase their personal nature balance and unlock more character miniatures.

By balancing the nature elements on the player boards, players will attract new characters into the garden. On each player turn, if the elements are balanced, the player will have to choose one miniature from the ones available and finally decide which one of the characters will be placed in the garden, orienting them towards their favorite background, while keeping the other with you to keep exploiting its ability.

2) Draw decoration cards and place one on the board to get prestige by completing collections.

Players will draw a quantity of cards based on the board situation and choose one to keep. Players will then have to place the chosen decoration in one of the available spots in the garden, creating a unique and seamless scenario that will never be the same.

During the game, by placing tiles on special parts of the board, you will be able to place a panorama tile, a new element that adds a never ending perspective for the visitors. Both small and big panoramas will be placed perpendicularly to the board by attaching it to the board insert by creating a seamless look on the four sides of the board. The Panoramas will interact with the characters at the end of the game by giving prestige points based on what your visitor sees and likes.

At the end of the game, the player with the most prestige will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lifeline
boardgame.description:
Lifeline is a territorial strategy game for two players (Black and White) that is played on the cells of an initially empty hexhex board. The recommended board sizes are between 3 and 12 cells per side. The game was invented by Michael Amundsen and Luis Bolaños Mures.



Definitions

A group is an entire set of connected stones of the same color. A single stone, not connected to others of its color, is also a group.

A group is dead if there is no path of connected empty cells between that group and any other of its color.



Play

On your turn, perform the following actions in the stated order:


Place a stone of your color on an empty cell. If it is your first turn of the game, perform this action twice.
Remove all dead enemy groups.
Remove all dead friendly groups.


The board positions at the start and at the end of your turn must be different.

The last player to make a placement wins. Note that, after your first turn, you will always have a placement available unless you have no groups on the board.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



Variants

The standard game is made fair by the combination of the double first move and White's swap option, as described above. This balancing method is called strong pie. Some alternatives are:


Weak pie: Instead of placing twice on their first turn, players place one stone on every turn, and dead groups are not removed until there are at least four stones on the board. White's swap option still applies, but takes place after Black has placed only one stone.



Komi pie: Before the game starts, the first player chooses a whole number as the komi value, and then the second player chooses sides. The first four stones are placed in the same manner as with weak pie, but there is no swap option after Black's fist placement. Throughout the game proper, White will have the option to spend a point of komi instead of making a placement.


Unlike strong pie, these methods require somewhat large boards to be effective: at least base 6 for weak pie, and at least base 7 for komi pie.

—description from the designers

boardgame.name: バトルオブジパング (Battle of Zipangu)
boardgame.description:
バトルオブジパング (Battle of Zipangu) is a card game from Japan. In feudal Japan, warlords are trying to establish their own kingdoms. Players use either building cards to gain rice, or soldiers to gain buildings. The first to get to five rice is the winner.

Players are dealt three cards from two decks, a buildings deck and a soldiers deck. On their turn, a player can place down a building or a soldier, or discard. The goal is to form sets, so a run of numbers on a soldiers lets the player attack and steal a building, or defend against attack. A flush on buildings lets a player draw rice chits. Some buildings give special effects too. Players must balance their need to gain rice and also defend or attack with soldiers, making tactical decisions as the game progresses.

The publisher says:
Become a champion of the Warring States period! Build buildings or attack the enemy with your soldiers in this easy to play strategy card game!

Players take on the role of a feudal lord in the Warring States period and compete with their opponents to build a kingdom. You play the role of a feudal lord, competing with your opponents to build a kingdom. The first player to collect 5 rice bale chips is the winner.

The first player to collect 5 rice bale chips is the winner. Rice bale chips can be obtained by creating roles with 2-3 building cards. You can also make a role with 3 soldier cards and take the enemy's building cards. Some of the building cards have special effects that can be used to your advantage. In this game, you have to choose between building with your cards and attacking with your soldiers.

The game takes only 20 minutes to play and is an easy strategy card game to enjoy!

This game was distributed at the 2019 Autumn Gemma, and we plan to distribute a new version with improved rules and design at the 2020 Autumn Gemma.

戦国時代の覇者となれ！建物を建てるか、兵士で敵を攻撃するか、手軽に遊べる戦略カードゲーム！
プレイヤーは戦国時代の大名となり、対戦相手と国造りを競います。先に米俵チップを5枚集めたプレイヤーが勝者となります。

米俵チップは建物カード2-3枚で役を作ることで手に入れることができます。また、兵士カード3枚で役を作り、敵の建物カードを奪うこともできます。建物カードには特殊効果があるものもあり、戦況を有利にすることができます。
自分の手札と相手の状況を見ながら、建物カードで建設するか、兵士カードで攻撃をするか、駆け引きを楽しめるゲームです。

プレイ時間も20分程度で、手軽に楽しめる戦略カードゲームです！

2019秋のゲムマで頒布しましたが、2020秋のゲムマでルールとデザインを改良したものを頒布予定です。

boardgame.name: Airships and Automatons
boardgame.description:
In Airships and Automatons players play as an Automaton that can convert into an Airship and back again. They will be traveling around their city sheet completing tasks with dice rolls. Certain areas require the player to be an Airship while other tasks require the player to be an Automaton. Further still, there are two spaces that can be used by either.

Players will have to move each turn, 1 space as an Automaton or up to 2 spaces as an Airship. They will use their dice to Convert, move an extra space or two, or activate their area of the City. Players also gain powers and create combos by completing tasks in the City.

Opportunities arise for players who are playing quickly to trigger a bonus by moving back into Area 1 of the City which allows all players to Convert, but the triggering player to earn a special bonus.

The game plays over 12 revolutions of the City sheet. Each revolution will last a number of rounds determined by the players. Will they play fast? Will they play slow to do all of the actions? The choices are plenty!

Scoring is done for each area with the players having a grand total at the end. The winning Automaton will have to master the clock as well as plan ahead each time focusing to maximize areas so they can outscore their rivals.

Airships and Automatons can be played solo or with up to 4 players. There are suggestions for how to combine the airships and automaton cards, but with this print and play format, players can create any number of combinations they choose. Additionally, printing out a set of cards for each player allows them to choose their own combinations and see if their own skill can beat their opponents when using the same Airship/Automaton combination!

Get ready to roll and write in this all new Steampunk game!

—description from the designer
